summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the forensic review of three hard drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence in July 2019. The warrant seeks evidence related to sex trafficking, transportation of minors, enticement, and conspiracy, specifically targeting communications, financial records, travel documents, and photographs involving Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and other co-conspirators and victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the investigation; the hard drives were seized from his private New York residence. The warrant seeks evidence of his co-conspirators and victims related to specified offenses.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Explicitly named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein. The warrant authorizes a search for evidence concerning her identity, location, and communications.

connections.description: Maxwell is explicitly identified as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein in the warrant, which seeks evidence of communications and activities between them related to the subject offenses.

events.title: Search of Epstein's New York Residence
events.description: Law enforcement executed a search at Jeffrey Epstein's private residence in New York, NY, seizing three 'Seagate Path 100' hard drives from a bookshelf cabinet in an oval study.

events.title: Warrant Issuance for Device Review
events.description: A magistrate judge issued this search warrant authorizing law enforcement to forensically review the three hard drives seized from Epstein's residence for evidence of crimes spanning 1994 to August 2019.

events.title: Endpoint for Investigative Period
events.description: The warrant defines the period for which evidence is sought as 1994 through August 8, 2019, the date of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

locations: Jeffrey Epstein's private residence (address redacted), New York, New York
keyFacts: The warrant authorizes the forensic examination of three specific hard drives (FBI barcodes E6433822, E6433824, E6433821) seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York home on July 11, 2019.
The search seeks evidence of violations including sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 1591), transportation of minors (ยง 2422), enticement to travel (ยง 2423), and conspiracy (ยง 371).
Ghislaine Maxwell is explicitly named as a co-conspirator, and the warrant seeks evidence concerning her identity, location, and communications with Epstein.

The warrant outlines ten specific categories of evidence to be sought, including communications, financial records, travel documents, and nude or sexually suggestive photographs of individuals who appear to be teenage girls or younger.
The investigative period covered by the warrant spans from 1994 through August 8, 2019, encompassing the time up to Epstein's death.
